title: Engineering
Program
in Computer Science
cursus.subtitle: The engineering program at the National School of Computer Science is divided into 2 cycles

cp.title: Preparatory Cycle
cp.description:
Two years during which the basic knowledge that an engineer must master before tackling more specific knowledge is taught.

Access to higher classes is subject to passing an exam whose conditions are set each year by order of the Minister of Higher Education.

This exam is open, under certain conditions, to students from certain fields taught in other university institutions.

cs.title: Advanced Cycle
cs.description: 1CS Common Core: After passing the exam, all students join the advanced cycle 1CS in the common core, covering the basic knowledge of computer engineering. 2CS Specialization Year: The student chooses one of the 4 available specializations for the 2CS year of study. 3CS Final Project + Master's/Entrepreneurship Training: The final year is dedicated to the end-of-study project lasting 9 months, with the possibility to pursue a Master's degree and entrepreneurship training simultaneously.

title: Life as a
SIT Student
life.description:
Imagine designing an enterprise architecture for major global companies. Consulting with a hedge fund on how to address the blockchain technology challenge. Working as an IT manager in one of the world's leading consulting firms.

As an information systems student at NUS, you will acquire the crucial skills necessary to prepare for exciting careers. Information systems involve the design, implementation, and management of IT. The field is vast, with potential careers in almost every sector.

NUS prides itself on offering the strongest technical IT foundation of any educational institution in the country. By studying information systems, you will receive world-class training in computer networks, enterprise systems, digital marketing, and management. It is a holistic field of study that prepares you for careers in IT management, systems architecture, network engineering, or any other area where people, IT, and systems intersect.

program.title: Programs
program.getPdf: You can get the complete program with detailed modules in PDFs

skills.title: Your Key Skills as a SIT Engineer

info.title: About Internships
info.description: ESI students benefit from 3 practical internships during their studies: discovery internship, practical internship, and final year project (PFE) internship, where they will put their skills into practice and immerse themselves in the professional world.

types.name: Discovery Internship
types.description: The objective is to allow students to learn about company structures and discover the dynamics of working within a company.

types.name: Practical Internship
types.description: During this internship, students must join a company, integrate into a team, and work with them by putting their knowledge into practice.

types.name: Final Year Project (PFE) Internship
types.description: The final internship in 3CS with which the student will defend their thesis to obtain their engineering diploma.

info.title: About the Master's
info.description: In the 5th year (3CS), ESI offers an optional program to obtain a Master's degree in computer engineering, in addition to the state engineering degree in computer science. The program, focused on the business world, also allows you to develop the practical skills and basic professional experience necessary to enter the job market.
